snippet: This is when early general-election polls start to become meaningful, and Donald J. Trump trails Hillary Clinton by around 10 percentage points.
abstract: The Upshot; News Analysis; Donald J Trump, who appears fairly certain to face Hillary Clinton in general election, would face steep challenge in defeating Clinton; polls show Trump, who remains deeply unpopular among female, college-educated and minority voters, trailing Clinton by 10 percentage points; gap, however, is not insurmountable in unpredictable contest.
lead_paragraph: This is when early general-election polls start to become meaningful, and Donald J. Trump trails Hillary Clinton by around 10 percentage points.

headline.print_headline: Past the G.O.P. Race, Severe Tests Loom in November
headline.main: Yes, It’s Early, but Donald Trump Would Have Uphill Battle Against Hillary Clinton
